strong.a: Click Here for Frequently Asked Questions

span.strong: Gates County Schools Remote Learning Plan
MESSAGE FROM DR. BARRY WILLIAMS, SUPERINTENDENT
AND THE BOARD OF EDUCATION
April 24, 2020

Today Governor Roy Cooper announced all public schools will continue remote learning, with classrooms closed to students, for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. The focus of this decision was the health and safety of students and staff. Additionally, meals for students will continue to be provided through our food service delivery system. Governor Cooper promised to continue to support DPI in assisting school divisions with issues such as providing access to the internet for students. He also commended teachers, food service staff, custodians, bus drivers, and other staff for their hard work and dedication to students during this time.

Governor Cooper also indicated that the COVID-19 pandemic will impact school divisions into the 2020-2021 school year but that he will work collaboratively with other agencies to open school safely in 2020-2021. It is not known at this time what this impact will entail but it will be guided by recommendations from health officials with guidelines established as we move through the pandemic.

State Superintendent Mark Johnson stated that guidance will be provided from his office and DPI early next week on moving forward with the school year. I will keep you updated on information as it is provided from the state level.
Thank you for all you are doing for the students of Gates County. Continue to be vigilant in remaining healthy and safe and I will be in touch again soon.
Respectfully,
The Gates County Board of Education & Dr. Williams
"Light It Up Blue" in Honor of
World Autism Awareness Day

span.strong: Gates County Preschool Program

div.strong: The Gates County Preschool Program is still taking preschool student applications for the 2020-2021 school year. You can download an application by clicking on the link: https://coserver.gates.k12.nc.us/Page/536
If you have any questions, please contact Lori Ward at 252-357-4133 or by email at loriward@gatescountyschools.net.

a.title: Go to comments for Gates County Preschool Program

span.p: Ray Felton, Chairman of the Gates County Board of Education, announces that the May Regular Session Board of Education Meeting will be held electronically on Monday, May 11, 2020, beginning with a Closed Session at 9:00 a.m., to discuss confidential personnel matters, as allowed by NCGS 143-318.11(a)(6), followed by an Open Session at 10:00 a.m.

strong.span: Board Members will participate by computer
The Closed Session is not open to the public.
Cathy Riddick, Adm. Asst. to the Superintendent
